intro: Werauhia ochracea, commonly known as the orange werauhia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking orange flowers that bloom in clusters, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Its leaves are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, forming a central cup that collects rainwater. Werauhia ochracea is often found growing in shaded, humid environments such as forests and rocky areas.
